clear

public void clear(java.net.URI uri)
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Clear internal cache partially or completely, that is, dispose one (all) cached reference(s) that is (are) kept of previously loaded ontologies.

Specified by:
clear in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology to remove from the cache. Completely clears the cache if value is null.

clearAlternativeLocation

public void clearAlternativeLocation(java.net.URI uri)
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Clear the alternative location for the ontology identified by the given URI, i.e., force that it will be loaded from this URI (i.e. it has to be a URL, in fact, that the system is able to resolve) when it is loaded/read the next time.

Specified by:
clearAlternativeLocation in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology for which to clear the alternative location.

getIgnoredOntologies

public java.util.Set<java.net.URI> getIgnoredOntologies()
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
The set of ontologies which will be ignored (i.e. not loaded) if they transitively occur as imports in a ontology to be loaded into a KB.

Specified by:
getIgnoredOntologies in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Returns:
The set of OWL ontologies we ignore when importing. Empty set if none was added.

removeIgnoredOntology

public boolean removeIgnoredOntology(java.net.URI uri)
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Remove the ontology identified by the given URI from the set of ontologies ignored in import statements.

Specified by:
removeIgnoredOntology in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology to take into account when importing.
Returns:
true If the set of ignored ontologies changed as a result of this method invocation, false otherwise.

setAlternativeLocation

public java.net.URI setAlternativeLocation(java.net.URI original,
                                           java.net.URI copy)
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Set an entry for a location where the ontology identified by the given URI can also be loaded/read from. This method needs to be invoked before the ontology is read/loaded to the KB that uses this manager.

Specified by:
setAlternativeLocation in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Parameters:
original - The default or main URL of the ontology document.
copy - URL representing an alternative location where a copy of the ontology document can be found.
Returns:
The previous alternative location, if any, or original otherwise.

setCaching

public void setCaching(boolean useCache)
Description copied from interface: OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Attention: When Jena is used as the backing RDF framework turning of caching only affects load/read of top-level ontologies and not imported ontologies. Imagine this property is switched to false. Thus, the internal cache will be entirely cleared. If a ontology that imports another ontology A is read/loaded afterwards, then A will be cached and any subsequent attempt to read/load another ontology that also imports A will get the cached reference (not accessing the source). This can only be circumvented by invoking OWLKnowledgeBaseManager.clear(URI) with the URI of A as the parameter.

Specified by:
setCaching in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Parameters:
useCache - If true references of already loaded ontologies will be kept in a internal (main memory) cache to efficiently reuse them. Note that switching from true to false involves clearing the entire cache, see OWLKnowledgeBaseManager.clear(URI).

usesCache

public boolean usesCache()
Specified by:
usesCache in interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager
Returns:
true if a cache is used which keeps previously loaded ontologies for reuse on repeated load, false otherwise.
